result.execSummary:
The defendant Shavarr R Patterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Escape-Criminal Arrest, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.42(3)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: Any other sentence; STRAIGHT TIME

miscConds.notes:
Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges including DNA; all applicable fees of supervision all to be paid by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Restitution in the amount of zero.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
- Cooperate with his probation agent.
- 50 hours of community service.
- A letter of apology to Miranda M.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Anger management.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain full time employment/education.
- Obtain GED/HSED.
- No Contact with Miranda M.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shavarr R Patterson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Dennis R. Cimpl, Br. 19, for review. spc
Defendant's pro se request for early release.

Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve  1 YEAR at the House of Corrections, straight time, with 35 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence.
Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 18 MONTHS probation.
  Conditions of Probation:
- No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
- Cooperate with his probation agent
- 50 hours of community service
- a letter of apology to Miranda M
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any treatment programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- anger management 
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education.
- Obtain GED/HSED
- No contact with: Miranda M
- Provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of zero
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  No Cash Bail on deposit.  Cash bail previously forfeited

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit

Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in custody.  Patrick Anderson for Ron Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk   As to Count 2:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, elements and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  As to Count 1:  Pursuant to negotiations Court ordered the count dismissed and read in.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant is ordered to provide a DNA sample.
Case passed.
Court enters an oral no contact order.  Defendant to have no contact with Bianco V and Miranda M.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court sets bail at $500.00 cash

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Shavarr R Patterson not in court, in custody.  Attorney Ron Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin via telephone.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 19.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defense requested the return on warrant be scheduled on 9/17/15 at 1:30 pm granted by the court.
Branch 19 scheduled a return on warrant on 9/11/2015 at 8:30 am.
NO REPLY FROM SURETY OR DEFENDANT.
Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bail forfeiture mailed to surety and defendant; Original in file. ($250.00) ad
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.
Defendant was ordered to appear 04/23/2015 by 2:30.  Defendant failing to appear, stay lifted and a bench warrant issued.  Plea and sentence hearing scheduled for 05/27/2015 is vacated.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 30 FOR BRANCH 22.
  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.    Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant issued but stayed the issuance for 24 hours.  Calendar call scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Parties have already been contacted to schedule a bail review from the last violation.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.  Parties contacted to schedule a bail review.

Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in court.  Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor appears telephonically.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Justice Point Pretrial Services Violation Report received and filed.   ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE.  Present in court is Justice Point Case Worker Kaitlyn Perego.  Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant.  No action taken at this time.  Court ordered Defendant report to Justice Point Services on Monday, April 13, 2015 at 10:00 am.  Case remains calendared for PLEAS on May 27, 2015 in Branch 22.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Shavarr R Patterson not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Plea Hearing, however defense requests that both Plea and Sentencing occur on the same date.  An appropriate date was selected.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Shavarr R Patterson not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for pre-trial conference.  Defense requests plea and sentencing date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Due to victim notification sentencing is scheduled tentatively for 05/27/2015 at 1:30pm.

Attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor in court, defendant Shavarr R Patterson not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

15RM011391  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:

Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in court with attorney Danielle Shelton for Valeria Lenise Taylor. Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court to address Justice Point violation.  Court admonishes the defendant, but does not amend bail.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22 for scheduling March 12, 2015 at 01:30pm.

Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 12, 2015 at 01:30pm.
To Reduce Bail.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MIRANDA M.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Defendant Shavarr R Patterson in custody.  Atty George Kidd, supervised by, David A. Feiss appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge WITKOWIAK, Branch 22.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 22.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
